message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public Comparable removeMin(){
    Iterator<T> iterator=iterator();
    T min = iterator.next();
    while (iterator.hasNext())
    {
        T next = iterator.next();
        if (min.compareTo(next) > 0)
            min = next;
    }
    data = Arrays.stream(data)
                 .filter(val -> val != min)
                 .toArray(Comparable[]::new);
    size--;
    return min;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The Comparable interface is used to order the objects of the user-defined class. It provides a single method named compareTo(Object). It can be used to compare the current object with the specified object. The Bag<T extends Comparable<T>> means that the type T must implement the Comparable interface. 

To remove the minimum item from the array, you can use the Java 8 Stream API to filter out the minimum value from the array. This will create a new array without the minimum value. Then, you decrease the size of the array by 1.
